meanings.definition: To make a solemn declaration or affirmation with an appeal to a deity or to some sacred object as witness.
meanings.sent1: I swear to always tell the truth in court.
meanings.sent2: She will swear on the Bible before testifying.
meanings.sent3: The boy had to swear on his favorite toy to prove he didn't eat the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The stars above seemed to swear to the truth of her promise.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes held a solemn gaze as he swore to protect the ancient artifact.

meanings.definition: To use profane oaths or language.
meanings.sent1: He would swear loudly when he hit his thumb with the hammer.
meanings.sent2: The angry driver began to swear at the other cars on the road.
meanings.sent3: The parrot shocked everyone by repeating the swear words it heard.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to swear at the land with its fierce winds and thunder.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's routine was full of cleverly placed swears that made the audience laugh.
